basics.name: Minh-Nam Tran
basics.label: Undergraduate Student & Research Assistant
basics.summary: A final-year undergraduate student at University of Science - VNUHCM and research assistant at Computational Linguistic Center. I am interested in studying Large Language Models, Large Vision Language Models and their capabilities in natural language understanding.

work.name: Viettel Headquarters - Viettel Group
highlights: Supervised by Dr. Nguyen Van Nam to complete a 6-month internship with two projects: solving table-to-text challenge and tackling text-to-SQL problem using LLMs.
Ranked in the top 5 of the DS/AI group during the second stage of the internship.

work.name: Computational Linguistics Center, HCMUS-VNUHCM
highlights: Worked as a research assistant, assisting with data analysis and data management for text-to-code problems and large language model applications.
Collaborated with team of researchers, compiled research findings for the team and contributed to project reports and presentations about large language models.

work.name: Users and Information Lab, KAIST
highlights: Engaged in a 2-month KAIST School of Computing Summer Internship program under the supervision of Professor Alice Oh and Ph.D candidate Rifki A. Putri.
Investigated in adapting the multilingual generative pre-trained language models to Vietnamese downstream tasks via multitask instruction learning.

work.name: AI VIET NAM
highlights: Led a team of six members in a code summarization project for developing a simple but highly interactive Streamlit application to generate docs from Python code.
Worked in the Daily Math Team, creating math exercises for ML and DL.
Translated TensorFlow-based project source code into the PyTorch framework to support the AIO2022 community.

publications.name: ViGLUE: A Vietnamese General Language Understanding Benchmark and Analysis of Vietnamese Language Models
publications.summary: This study introduces ViGLUE, a Vietnamese General Language Understanding Evaluation benchmark, developed through translation, corpus generation, and dataset aggregation. ViGLUE comprises twelve tasks across ten domains, enabling thorough model assessment.

publications.name: Multi-perspective Traffic Video Description Model with Fine-grained Refinement Approach
publications.summary: This paper proposes a novel methodology for generating comprehensive descriptions of traffic scenarios combining a vision-language model (VLM) with rule-based refinements to capture pertinently pedestrian vehicle and environment factor.
